newsitem.title: INDIA: India rupee dips on dlr demand from state-run bank.
newsitem.headline: India rupee dips on dlr demand from state-run bank.

text.p: The Indian rupee weakened on dollar demand from a large state-run bank in afternoon trade on Friday to touch 35.71/72 per dollar, dealers said.

The rupee traded at a high of 35.65 and a low of 35.72 per dollar, they said. "The rupee was in a 35.65/67 band for much of the morning," a dealer at a foreign bank said. "Late demand from a state-run bank weakened it to 35.71/72."
Forward premia fell initially on reports of a cut in cash reserve requirements but moved back on paying pressure to close at the previous day's levels, dealers said.
